videoSnippet.title: Happy 50th Birthday, Vishy! || A Game Between Legends || Anand vs Kasparov
videoSnippet.description:
Watch Anand video here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LjW9W-h_-WI&feature=youtu.be&fbclid=IwAR25mgh_VgVwntY-7RxV2kpglzHBMlDKO2Jq2Oitwbn5yxwUsDI-ksO-aMw

SEND US YOUR PHOTOS AND VIDEOS HERE subscribers.videos.agadmator@gmail.com

Follow me on Instagram for extra content https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Viswanathan Anand vs Garry Kasparov
Kasparov - Anand PCA World Championship Match (1995), New Sicilian Defense: Scheveningen. Classical Variation (B84) 

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cd4 4. Nd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be2 e6 7. O-O Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. Be3 O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bd7 13. Nb3 Na5 14. Na5 Qa5 15. Qd3 Rad8 16. Rfd1 Bc6 17. b4 Qc7 18. b5 Bd7 19. Rab1 ab5 20. Nb5 Bb5 21. Qb5 Ra8 22. c4 e5 23. Bb6 Qc8 24. fe5 de5 25. a5 Bf8 26. h3 Qe6 27. Rd5 Nd5 28. ed5 Qg6 29. c5 e4 30. Be2 Re5 31. Qd7 Rg5 32. Rg1 e3 33. d6 Rg3 34. Qb7 Qe6 35. Kh2

Although stripped of his title by FIDE for holding his 1993 match with Short outside the world chess body's auspices, Kasparov was nevertheless widely considered the legitimate World Champion. The Professional Chess Association (PCA) created by Kasparov held a series of a series of candidate matches to choose an opponent for him. Viswanathan Anand succeeded in becoming the champion's opponent.

Anand's rise in the chess world was meteoric. Born in India, he quickly emerged as his nation's greatest player. At age fifteen, he became the youngest Indian to win the International Master title. At the age of sixteen he was crowned India's National Champion. In 1987 he was the first Indian to win the World Junior Championship. In 1988, at the age of eighteen, he became the first official Grandmaster of India. Anand qualified for the PCA World Championship final by winning the candidates matches against Michael Adams and Gata Kamsky.

Read more here https://www.chessgames.com/perl/chess.pl?tid=55522
